author: Staff Reporter
text:
The indefinite strike by the employees of Commercial Tax department demanding fulfilment of their 10 demands continued for the 18{+t}{+h}day here on Monday.

They said that their department contributes 75 per cent of the total revenue to the State government, but their demands were not met. Their demands include releasing of promotion list, filling of vacancies, dropping disciplinary action against employees and also fulfilling other demands. They said that the government is not going to incur additional expense by fulfilling their demands. “Our indefinite strike and fasting did not yield any results so far as the government failed to address our concern”, they added.

Hence, employees would stage demonstration on Tuesday also, while all employees would stage protest outside the office of the Commissioner of Commercial Tax on February 24, they added.
title: Indefinite strike by employees of Commercial Tax dept. continues
